22 // A struct is a class without member fn's/methods, only contains
23 // member data, use a struct in this case.
24 //

35 namespace a3_help{
36  // a3_help is a class not a type, so can't be used as a varible type,
37  // eg a3_help::RequestGoal::Request &req
38 
41 
42  class RequestGoal{
43 
44  public:
45  // Accessable methods and variables to all classes, not just member
46  // fn's of this class.
47 
48  // The request of service request_goal is declared as this struct.
49  //
50  struct Request{
51 
52  // The robot moves in the x,y plane and around the z-axis(this angle
53  // is aka yaw).
54  //
55  // All these members define the robot 'goal', or goto pose, required
56  // for the next move.
57  //
58  // Pose = Position and Orientation.
59  //
60  double x; // postion of robot along x-axis in metres
61  double y; // postion of robot along y-axis in metres
62  double angle; // angle/yaw in radians, the robot is rotated
63  // about the z-axis at this angle
64  double scanTime; // how often the request_goal service is
65  // called, ie how often the requestGoal()
66  // callback fn is called
67 
68  };
69 
70 
71  // The responce to the service request_goal is declared as this struct.
72  //
73  struct Response{
74 
75  bool ack; // true=> robot move succeeded, ie requestGoal()
76  // returns true. If false=> robot move failed,
77  // requestGoal() returns false
78 
79  };
80 
81 
82  // No constructors needed I think, this class just creates two
83  // types, the Request and the Reponse stuctures???
